description: Hindi and Persian سرکار‎ (sarkâr, “superintendent, overseer, chief”).

examples: […]  and there would be various objections to trusting a native with the purport of such communications, even where some of the baboos, sircars, purvoes, and others of that genus, can converse with sufficient comprehensiveness in English  […]

entries.meaning: (India) A district or province; a circar.
(India) The government; the supreme authority of the state.
